text: Arebhashe is a dialect of Kannada spoken mainly by Gowda and other communities in the region of Kodagu (Coorg) as well as Sullia of Dakshina Kannada in the Indian state of Karnataka. It is spoken in the Bandadka Village of Kasaragod district of Kerala state. In Sullia Taluk, as the majority of the population belongs to the Gowda community,,https://www.coorga2z.in/regional/kodagu- arebhashe-gowdas-ethnic-group/, Kodagu Arebhashe Gowdas – A Ethnic Group most of others communicate language in the same dialect. ==Etymology== It is a dialect of Kannada while using languages become semi-linguistic so it may have been called half language or Arebhashe(Are:half, Bhashe:speech). It has admixture of Old Kannada(). It also called as Gowda Kannada this termed coined by the Late Mariyappa Bhat,https://www.deccanherald.com/spectrum/spectrum-top- stories/arebase-a-dialect-rooted-in-cultural-harmony-868290.html, Arebase: A dialect rooted in cultural harmony, Charan Ivarnadu, 01 August 2020 Some of the letters ಙ,ಞ fading from Kannada still remain in this language. == Pronouns == {| class="wikitable" |- !
